snippet: Federal officials cited glaring safety violations in proposing nearly $400,000 in fines against two companies involved in a demolition in Philadelphia that killed six people.
abstract: Federal officials cite glaring violations of safety standards in proposing nearly $400,000 in fines against Campbell Construction and S&R Contracting, two companies that were involved in botched building demolition in Philadelphia that killed six people.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials cited glaring safety violations in proposing nearly $400,000 in fines against two companies involved in a demolition in Philadelphia that killed six people.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: U.S. Proposes Fines in Deadly Building Collapse
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: U.S. Proposes Fines In Deadly Collapse of Building
